page.title: 13COLLEGE OF HORTICULTURE
page.content: The Horticultural Unit of the West Sussex College of Agriculture and Horticulture started in 1965. It has about 1 acre of heated glasshouses and polythene tunnels. Tomatoes and cucumbers are raised in a range of alternative growing systems. Year round chrysanthemiums and alstroemeria are grown as cut flowers,the glasshouses being lit artificially at night. Other crops include poinsettias, mushrooms and fruit growing in a small orchard. The College maintains a small apiary in the orchard. As well as giving demonstrations to schools and tuition for students, Brinsbury is also used for meetings and conventions by the West Sussex Beekeepers Association. 3 staff supervise courses for the National Certificate in Horticulture and City and Guilds examinations.
